solution_line_template: First find the total weight of the soda by multiplying the number of crates by the weight per crate: {num_soda_crates} crates * {weight_per_soda_crate} pounds/crate = <<{num_soda_crates}*{weight_per_soda_crate}={total_soda_weight}>>{total_soda_weight} pounds

Then find the weight of the fresh produce by doubling the weight of the soda: {total_soda_weight} pounds * {multiplier_for_produce} = <<{total_soda_weight}*{multiplier_for_produce}={total_produce_weight}>>{total_produce_weight} pounds

Now find the weight of the dryers by multiplying the quantity by the weight per item: {num_dryers} dryers * {weight_per_dryer} pounds/dryer = <<{num_dryers}*{weight_per_dryer}={total_dryer_weight}>>{total_dryer_weight} pounds

Now add the empty truck's weight to the weight of all three groups of products to find the fully loaded weight: {empty_truck_weight} pounds + {total_soda_weight} pounds + {total_produce_weight} pounds + {total_dryer_weight} pounds = <<{empty_truck_weight}+{total_soda_weight}+{total_produce_weight}+{total_dryer_weight}={fully_loaded_truck_weight}>>{fully_loaded_truck_weight} pounds
